bill_title: to allow municipalities to operate an electric utility system beyond its corporate limits under certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow municipalities to operate an electric utility system beyond its corporate limits under certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 9-40 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If state or federal law mandates or permits open access to retail delivery of electric energy, a municipality operating an electric utility system may sell electric energy at retail beyond the corporate limits of the municipality to the extent its governing body determines that such service is reasonably necessary to enable the municipality to provide such utility services at competitive rates to its customers and to comply with the state and federal policies, laws, rules, and regulations governing the operations of such services, including policies, laws, rules, and regulations which provide for competition among electric utility providers. However, this section does not limit the authority of the Public Utilities Commission to assign service areas pursuant to § 49-34A-44. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
